newsitem.title: CANADA: Ranger Oil boosts North Sea field stake.
newsitem.headline: Ranger Oil boosts North Sea field stake.

text.p: Canada's Ranger Oil Ltd said on Monday it agreed to buy an additional 29.29 percent interest in its operated Anglia gas field in the North Sea from Amerada Hess Corp.
Ranger said the acquisition would boost its holding in the natural gas field to 67.2 percent.
The Anglia gas field lies in Blocks 48/18b and 48/19b and started production as Ranger's first operated development in the North Sea in November 1991.
During 1996, it flowed at an average rate of 45 million cubic feet per day. Ranger said it planned an infill drilling program for the field in 1997.
Ranger also said on Monday it agreed to sell Amerada a 17 percent interest in Block 29/8b and 10 percent interest in Block 29/9b on the U.K. Continental Shelf.
The sales would leave Ranger with 16 percent and 36 percent interests respectively in the two blocks.
The transactions were subject to the consent of Britain's Department of Trade and Industry, Ranger said. ((Reuters Calgary Bureau (403) 531-1624))
